questions.question: 1. Which of the following statements are correct about a binary tree?

answers.a: A node in a binary tree can have exactly two children
answers.b: A node in a binary tree can have at most two children
answers.c: A node in a binary tree can have two or more children
answers.d: A node in a binary tree can have more than one root

explanations.a: A node can also have less than two children in a binary tree
explanations.b: Yes, a node in binary tree can have zero, one or two children
explanations.c: Children count of binary tree node cannot exceed 2, hence it is called “binary”
explanations.d: No, if a node has more than one parent(root), then there is a possibility of cycle in the tree, which violates the tree property

questions.question: 2. Node values in a binary tree always appear in a sorted order from root to leaf, going left to right at each level.

explanations.a: No, there is no particular order followed among the nodes in a binary tree.

questions.question: 3. Which of the following is TRUE about the leaf nodes of a binary tree?

answers.a: Leaf nodes in a binary tree have no children
answers.b: At Least one leaf node in a binary tree has two children
answers.c: Leaf nodes in a binary tree are allowed to have more than two children
answers.d: Leaf nodes in a binary tree may or may not have child nodes

explanations.b: No, if a node has two children, then it wouldn’t be called a leaf node.
explanations.c: No, if a node has two or more childrens, then it wouldn’t be called a leaf node. Moreover in a binary tree, a node can have at most two children.
explanations.d: No, if a node has children, then it wouldn’t be called a leaf node.

questions.question: 4. In a binary tree all nodes are connected.

explanations.b: If nodes are not connected, then it would form multiple trees, and hence would be called a forest.

questions.question: 5. Which of the following is TRUE about a binary tree?

answers.a: There exists a cycle between nodes in a binary tree
answers.b: There may or may not be a cycle in a binary tree
answers.c: A binary tree does not have any cycles
answers.d: There should be at least one cycle in a binary tree

explanations.a: If there is a cycle in a tree, then it would disobey the property of the tree.
explanations.b: If there is a cycle in a tree, then it would disobey the property of the tree.
explanations.c: The basic property of the tree is that it doesn’t contain any cycle, else it would become a graph.
explanations.d: If there is a cycle in a tree, then it would disobey the property of the tree.
